column4: 'ello. I want to identify which device name my usb memory stick has (well it's actually an mp3 player)... i want to format it to fat32, but don't know which device it is
look at the output of dmesg
where should it say that? it just wants to open the folder.....
use the terminal
oh you mean i should use dmesg before pluging it in?
no
if Ubuntu automatically mounts it (it's available in Nautilus), you can use the mount command to see what device it mounted on /media/disk (or wherever)
i don't think it's listing it.... maybe it's because the current file system is "gphoto"?
use the terminal
i did. i wrote "mount"
if it's mounted, it will show there.  If it's not, then you'll have to use dmesg from the terminal
nautilus give it a nice big label... my other drives are listed when i use the mount command... but i don't see the usb
well. it's mounted because i can see the files in it
i just don't know WHICH one it is in the mount command
is /media/whatever listed in mount?
media/disk1 and disk2 are listed yes
but not my mp3 player
how do you know?  Can you "cd /media/disk{1,2}" and see your mp3 files?
no, those under media are my other drives..i know their labels
so it's not mounted, use dmesg
the label is "SanDisk Corp. SanDisk Sansa m240"
that doesn't mean much
